title: VFX in American Gods
credit_line:
Title sequence creative director: Patrick Clair
Courtesy Fremantle
brief_description: A look at the acclaimed title sequence from American Gods, by VFX studio Antibody.

constellations_primary.name: The world's end
constellations_primary.description: For people of colour oppressed by systemic racism, genre stories about the end of the world and cosmological monsters can be used to re-examine race and the injustices faced in real life.

description: Growing up in a Catholic home, Patrick Clair was used to seeing religious iconography. Little did he know he would one day have the opportunity to merge and subvert it with his work at motion graphics studio Antibody, alongside Raoul Marks. Having redefined the art of opening credits during the peak TV era, American Gods (2017–present) saw the Antibody team mix religious and patriotic symbolism together for their most daring work yet as they brought the mythologies of Neil Gaiman’s source material to life.
